To find the depth of node xb, we need to trace the path from the root node (z) to node xb. Depth is defined by the number of edges traversed from the root to reach a specific node. Here's the path depicted in the tree structure:

```
z (depth 0)
├── ab (depth 1)
│   └── ...
├── vb (depth 1)
│   ├── wb (depth 2)
│   │   └── xb (depth 3)
│   └── ...
├── qc (depth 1)
│   └── ...
└── ld (depth 1)
    └── ...
```

The depth of node xb is 3, as it is three edges away from the root node.
